remarks: The sum of the lengths of two reversed parts of a word is the length of the word.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Apr-2018.)
statement: addlenrevswrd $p |- ( ( W e. Word V /\ M e. ( 0 ... ( # ` W ) ) ) -> ( ( # ` ( W substr <. M , ( # ` W ) >. ) ) + ( # ` ( W substr <. 0 , M >. ) ) ) = ( # ` W ) ) $.
